questions.question: Which of the following is a key characteristic that distinguishes 'tame fields' from 'defectless fields' in the context of valued fields?
options: Tame fields have trivial value groups.
Tame fields have perfect residue fields and p-divisible value groups (where applicable).
Defectless fields are always a subclass of tame fields.
Tame fields are defined by their characteristic being zero.

questions.question: What significant relationship does Theorem 1.2 in the paper establish?
options: It proves that all tame fields are defectless.
It proves that all defectless fields are tame.
It establishes a connection between roughly tame fields and fields where all algebraic extensions are defectless.
It shows that tameness is a property of the value group alone.
